{\bfseries Function\+:} Chart\+Navigate~\newline

\item {\bfseries position} \+: \mbox{[}in\mbox{]} Chart position to perform a shift. Can be one of the values. 
\item {\bfseries shift} \+: \mbox{[}in\mbox{]} Number of bars to shift the chart. Positive value means the right shift (to the end of chart), negative value means the left shift (to the beginning of chart). The zero shift can be used to navigate to the beginning or end of chart.

{\bfseries Function\+:} Object\+Create~\newline
 {\bfseries Description\+:} The function creates an object with the specified name, type, and the initial coordinates in the specified chart subwindow of the specified chart. There are two variants of the function\+:~\newline
 {\bfseries U\+RL\+:} \href{http://docs.mql4.com/objects/objectcreate.html}{\tt http\+://docs.\+mql4.\+com/objects/objectcreate.\+html}~\newline
 {\bfseries J\+S\+ON Input Parameters\+:}~\newline
 


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item {\bfseries chart\+\_\+id} \+: \mbox{[}in\mbox{]} Chart identifier. 
\item {\bfseries object\+\_\+name} \+: \mbox{[}in\mbox{]} Name of the object. The name must be unique within a chart, including its subwindows. 
\item {\bfseries object\+\_\+type} \+: \mbox{[}in\mbox{]} Object type. The value can be one of the values of the enumeration. 
\item {\bfseries sub\+\_\+window} \+: \mbox{[}in\mbox{]} Number of the chart subwindow. 0 means the main chart window. The specified subwindow must exist (window index must be greater or equal to 0 and less than ), otherwise the function returns false.

\item {\bfseries price1} \+: \mbox{[}in\mbox{]} The price coordinate of the first anchor point. 
\item {\bfseries timeN} \+: \mbox{[}in\mbox{]} The time coordinate of the N-\/th anchor point. 
\item {\bfseries priceN} \+: \mbox{[}in\mbox{]} The price coordinate of the N-\/th anchor point.

{\bfseries Function\+:} Text\+Set\+Font~\newline

\begin{DoxyItemize}

\item {\bfseries size} \+: \mbox{[}in\mbox{]} The font size that can be set using positive and negative values. In case of positive values, the size of a displayed text does not depend on the operating system\textquotesingle{}s font size settings. {\bfseries Function\+:} Window\+Screen\+Shot~\newline
 {\bfseries Description\+:} Saves current chart screen shot as a G\+IF file.~\newline

 {\bfseries J\+S\+ON Input Parameters\+:}~\newline
 


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item {\bfseries filename} \+: \mbox{[}in\mbox{]} Screen shot file name. Screenshot is saved to  folder. 
\item {\bfseries size\+\_\+x} \+: \mbox{[}in\mbox{]} Screen shot width in pixels. 
\item {\bfseries size\+\_\+y} \+: \mbox{[}in\mbox{]} Screen shot height in pixels. 
\item {\bfseries start\+\_\+bar} \+: \mbox{[}in\mbox{]} Index of the first visible bar in the screen shot. If 0 value is set, the current first visible bar will be shot. If no value or negative value has been set, the end-\/of-\/chart screen shot will be produced, indent being taken into consideration. 
\item {\bfseries chart\+\_\+scale} \+: \mbox{[}in\mbox{]} Horizontal chart scale for screen shot. Can be in the range from 0 to 5. If no value or negative value has been set, the current chart scale will be used. 
\item {\bfseries chart\+\_\+mode} \+: \mbox{[}in\mbox{]} Chart displaying mode. It can take the following values\+: C\+H\+A\+R\+T\+\_\+\+B\+AR (0 is a sequence of bars), C\+H\+A\+R\+T\+\_\+\+C\+A\+N\+D\+LE (1 is a sequence of candlesticks), C\+H\+A\+R\+T\+\_\+\+L\+I\+NE (2 is a close prices line). If no value or negative value has been set, the chart will be shown in its current mode.
